modules.description: This module defines the structure and creation of Ninja build rules, including their associated commands and descriptions. It works with strings for rule names, and expressions and bindings for variables, commands, and descriptions. It is used to generate correctly formatted Ninja build file rules when building OCaml projects with Clerk.

This module represents and formats Ninja build expressions as lists of strings, where each list element corresponds to a token in the expression. It provides the `format` function to write these expressions to a formatter, escaping spaces in individual tokens. It is used to construct and output valid Ninja syntax for build rules and commands, such as specifying compiler flags or file paths.

This module constructs Ninja build statements with functions to specify inputs, outputs, variables, and rules. It operates on expressions and variables defined in the `Ninja_utils` module, producing formatted build commands. Use it to generate precise Ninja syntax for build files, such as defining compilation steps or phony targets.

This module represents Ninja build file variables, handling both variable declarations and their usage in expressions. It provides operations to create variables, retrieve their base names, and format them for use in Ninja syntax. Useful for generating build rules where variables are referenced in command strings or output paths.

This module defines a type `t` representing default values in Ninja build configurations and provides functions to construct and format these values. It works with `Ninja_utils.Expr.t` expressions to create default value specifications and format them for output. Concrete use cases include setting default targets or variables in Ninja build files generated by the Clerk build system.

This module represents variable bindings in Ninja build files, pairing variables with their assigned expressions. It provides operations to construct bindings and format them for output, supporting global variable declarations. Useful for generating Ninja syntax programmatically when building configuration files.

This module generates Ninja build files with functions to construct variables, expressions, bindings, rules, and build statements. It works with strings, lists of strings, and custom types representing Ninja syntax elements to produce correctly formatted output. Concrete use cases include defining compiler commands, setting build targets, and generating configuration files for Clerk-based OCaml projects.
